title: Welcome to the Claude Code iOS Starter!
body: This is a demo post showing how the app works with local data. The app can seamlessly switch between network data and local fallback data for reliable development and testing.

title: Building with The Composable Architecture
body: This starter template demonstrates modern iOS development patterns using TCA for state management, SwiftUI for UI, and Tuist for project organization.

title: Modular Architecture Example
body: The codebase is organized into distinct modules: Features for app logic, CoreKit for business logic, and DesignSystem for UI components. This promotes reusability and maintainability.

title: Network Resilience Patterns
body: The app demonstrates proper error handling, retry logic, and fallback mechanisms. This ensures a great user experience even when network conditions are poor.

title: Accessibility First Design
body: All UI components include proper accessibility labels and traits, ensuring the app works well with VoiceOver and other assistive technologies.

title: Testing with TCA
body: The template includes comprehensive test examples using TestStore, showing how to test reducers, effects, and state transitions in TCA applications.

title: Modern Swift Patterns
body: The code demonstrates modern Swift features including async/await, actor isolation, and structured concurrency for robust app development.

title: Dependency Injection
body: Using TCA's Dependencies framework, the app shows how to properly inject dependencies for networking, persistence, and other services.

title: Design System Integration
body: The DesignSystem module provides consistent colors, typography, and spacing tokens used throughout the app for a cohesive visual experience.

title: Ready for Production
body: This starter template includes all the foundational pieces needed to build production-ready iOS applications: navigation, networking, error handling, testing, and documentation.
